segment.source: Basic security audit policy settings are found under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesAudit Policy.
segment.target: Basic security audit policy settings are found under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesAudit Policy.

segment.source: Basic security audit policy settings are found under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesAudit Policy.
segment.target: Basic security audit policy settings are found under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesAudit Policy.

segment.source: Determines whether to audit each instance of a user logging on to or logging off from another device in which this device is used to validate the account.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit each instance of a user logging on to or logging off from another device in which this device is used to validate the account.

segment.source: Determines whether to audit each event of account management on a device.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit each event of account management on a device.

segment.source: Determines whether to audit the event of a user accessing an Active Directory object that has its own system access control list (SACL) specified.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit the event of a user accessing an Active Directory object that has its own system access control list (SACL) specified.

segment.source: Determines whether to audit each instance of a user logging on to or logging off from a device.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit each instance of a user logging on to or logging off from a device.

segment.source: Determines whether to audit the event of a user accessing an object--for example, a file, folder, registry key, printer, and so forth--that has its own system access control list (SACL) specified.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit the event of a user accessing an object--for example, a file, folder, registry key, printer, and so forth--that has its own system access control list (SACL) specified.

segment.source: Determines whether to audit every incident of a change to user rights assignment policies, audit policies, or trust policies.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit every incident of a change to user rights assignment policies, audit policies, or trust policies.

segment.source: Determines whether to audit each instance of a user exercising a user right.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit each instance of a user exercising a user right.

segment.source: Determines whether to audit detailed tracking information for events such as program activation, process exit, handle duplication, and indirect object access.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit detailed tracking information for events such as program activation, process exit, handle duplication, and indirect object access.

segment.source: Determines whether to audit when a user restarts or shuts down the computer or when an event occurs that affects either the system security or the security log.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit when a user restarts or shuts down the computer or when an event occurs that affects either the system security or the security log.
